text: Hi <@U25PYL3Q8> We have check the slider again but we don´t know which styles should we override. We load slider css after the bootstrap. Is there any way you could help us?
whats the url again?
<@U39U75WDS>  Whats the url?
<@U25PYL3Q8> <http://www.theniu.com|www.theniu.com>
<@U25PYL3Q8> looks like its <http://www.theniu.com/>
yes! that one

<@U39U75WDS> this looks like a similar situation <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23539463/bootstrap-3-carousel-white-background-when-sliding> seems it has to do with the `.left` or `.right` class and if you added any css for that class

I have removed the lateral arrows with the left and right class on them. But I have developed another slider in <http://Theniu.com|Theniu.com> you can see it at the end of this page <http://www.theniu.com/work_ivf>
This one is working perfectly on Iphone
I tried deleting all custom styles I added but the problem is still there in the slider on the home page
I don´t know what else to try. Any idea would help me! Thanks

So, the only thing that I see here is that the slider is using background-image. I did some testing and when I set the inline styling to be using
     background: rgba(0,0,0,0) url(imageurl.jpg) 
It seemed to not have the background image.
So
possibly somethi ng like .item { background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0) }
or .carousel-inner * { background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0) }
may need to add an !important
I feel like it is happening when the "left" class is being added via the script
nope, I lied. That doesn't seem to work

I'm not exactly sure how to properly debug this and test -- Personally I always use the the HubSpot slider in husbpot and edit the css to make it work how I want to so that I don't run into issues like this
I'll give a look at it again later once I get some more brain space
